text: hi good afternoon everyone I'm Rakim
Mera an MBA from the class of
2009 I'm co-founder of micro Home
Solutions and interdisciplinary social
Enterprise formed to address the
low-income housing problems for the
urban poor in India let me share with
you the magnitude of the problem India
is only 25% Urban today and we already
have a 25 to 40 million housing deficit
what we risk creating are low income
ghettos for the poor and world-class
City for the rich housing is not an
infrastructural problem it is about
sustainable community building and we
are missing an opportunity for creating
inclusive codependent
cities MHS brings an interdisciplinary
approach to the debate on housing based
on our three founding
principles Community engagement access
to finance and architecture and
functional design our role today is to
activate the market to get stakeholders
excited to find the right partners for
ensuring scale up and operational
viability contrary to popular actions
the key lies in segmenting the market
and the housing market for the poor is
extremely diverse we have outlined it in
four broad categories first modular
shelters for working homeless
rental Housing Home Improvements and
lastly home ownership the market much
overlooked and where almost 2 million
people currently living in Delhi is the
Home Improvement Market the one we are
tackling
first the poor and low-income households
are engaging in self-c construction
through informal sources of Finance the
buildings are un extremely unsafe and
with poor quality
design we've just partnered with basic a
micr finance institution and reached 40
families facilitating access to finance
and Tech professional technical
assistance we are now designing the
phase two of our
pilot a key milestone for micr Home
Solutions in the next year is to engage
and excite other Financial players to
address and provide diverse products for
the Home Improvement in construction
space and more importantly to ensure
that the clients get a safe and a well-
constructed
house the HBS social entrepreneurship
Fellowship award is a true honor and
timely
encouragement personally it's given me a
renewed sense of responsibility on the
leadership role I can play in the social
housing space in
India I am Rakim Hera and I want to use
my MBA to create Housing Solutions for
the urban poor
